channel.title: How to network a printer
channel.description:
Originally from http://www.microsoft.com/windowsxp/using/networking/expert/honeycutt_july2.mspx
To share the printer, open the Printers and Faxes folder on the computer that is connected to your printer.
Open the Printers and Faxes folder
In the Printers and Faxes folder, click the printer's icon and, in the tasks pane, click Share This Printer.
I open the printer's Properties dialog box, and click on the Sharing tab.
Clicked Share Name, and then click OK.
That's it—the printer is now immediately available for other computers to use.
Now that you have a network printer, here is how to connect to it.
Open Control Panel, and click Printers and Other Hardware.
Clicked Add a Printer.
Instead of adding a local printer, I click Printer Connection and then browse the network for the printer and install it.
There you go, you now networked a printer, this is dead useful because now you can think up some pretty useful tricks to pull on people you know or a school computer, for example printing 10,000 pages of porn from someone's printer ;).

But very helpfull, now my brother doesn’t have to bother me every time he needs to print something. <<

item.title: How to network a printer
item.dc:creator: @RXVL RXVL
item.description:
@RXVL wrote:

Originally from http://www.microsoft.com/windowsxp/using/networking/expert/honeycutt_july2.mspx

To share the printer, open the Printers and Faxes folder on the computer that is connected to your printer.

Open the Printers and Faxes folder

In the Printers and Faxes folder, click the printer’s icon and, in the tasks pane, click Share This Printer.

I open the printer’s Properties dialog box, and click on the Sharing tab.

Clicked Share Name, and then click OK.

That’s it—the printer is now immediately available for other computers to use.

Now that you have a network printer, here is how to connect to it.

Open Control Panel, and click Printers and Other Hardware.

Clicked Add a Printer.

Instead of adding a local printer, I click Printer Connection and then browse the network for the printer and install it.

There you go, you now networked a printer, this is dead useful because now you can think up some pretty useful tricks to pull on people you know or a school computer, for example printing 10,000 pages of porn from someone’s printer ;).
